Quick search

IphToLcoefcr Module¶

Wrapper for SAM Simulation Core model: cmod_iph_to_lcoefcr.cpp

Creating an Instance¶

There are three methods to create a new instance of a PySAM module. Using default populates the newclass’ attributes with default values specific to a config. Each technology-financialconfiguration corresponds to a SAM GUI configuration. Using new creates an instance with empty attributes. The wrap function allows compatibility with PySSC, for details, refer to PySSC.

IphToLcoefcr model description

Calculate levelized cost of heat using fixed charge rate method for industrial process heat models

PySAM.IphToLcoefcr.default(config) → IphToLcoefcr¶

Use financial model-specific default attributes config options:

  • “DSGLIPHLCOHCalculator”

  • “PhysicalTroughIPHLCOHCalculator”

PySAM.IphToLcoefcr.new() → IphToLcoefcr¶
PySAM.IphToLcoefcr.wrap(ssc_data_t) → IphToLcoefcr¶

Use existing PySSC data

Warning

Do not call PySSC.data_free on the ssc_data_t provided to wrap

Functions¶

class PySAM.IphToLcoefcr.IphToLcoefcr¶

This class contains all the variable information for running a simulation. Variables are grouped together in the subclasses as properties. If property assignments are the wrong type, an error is thrown.

assign(dict) → None¶

Assign attributes from nested dictionary, except for Outputs

nested_dict = { 'IPH LCOH': { var: val, ...}, ...}

execute(int verbosity) → None¶

Execute simulation with verbosity level 0 (default) or 1

export() → dict¶

Export attributes into nested dictionary

IPHLCOH Group¶

class PySAM.IphToLcoefcr.IphToLcoefcr.IPHLCOH¶
assign() → None¶

Assign attributes from dictionary

IPHLCOH_vals = { var: val, ...}

export() → dict¶

Export attributes into dictionary

annual_electricity_consumption¶

float: Annual electricity consumptoin w/ avail derate [kWe-hr]

Required: True

electricity_rate¶

float: Cost of electricity used to operate pumps/trackers [$/kWe]

Required: True
